intro: Brickellia saltillensis, commonly known as the Mexican brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in dense, disc-like structures, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Brickellia saltillensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
